instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message:
Hi there,

First it had a typical gpu problems. Stuck on boot screen loading video drivers.
Did a diagnostic reflow. Everything works good again. Changed GPU chip. Tested, ALL system parameters functional.
A week later he comes back with other type of video problems: Straight after screen goes on, image is badly distorted (see pictures), after it loads video drivers goes to normal (not distorted) blank image and thenm sometimes boots to OS, sometimes restarts.
Pressing on Vram doesnt help.
Wierd, I have never seen these type of image distortions before. Could you advice on what that could be? 

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message: did you remove glue from VRAM before GPU replacement??

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message:
No Title

Yes sir! See for yourself. Should I give those bastards a proper reflow first with some tasty flux.

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message: Reflowed video ram and now it boots to OS without any image distortions. However, when running stress test, it crashes after 5 minutes. Do you think its memory? Or should I try to solder another GPU chip?

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message: It's the vias in the board, it's trash.

threads.title: 820-2915 Video problems
threads.message: That is sad. Please close this threat.
